reviews.review_msg: The best teacher I have ever had. Had him 2 semesters in a row luckily and he is so fair and laid back. He is exactly what you want in a prof. He makes learning such a comfortable environment without putting large amounts of stress on course work. We worked in groups majority of the time, but he was always available for help

Peter sets a true example for a scholar, and inspires you to be better in every aspect of your life. The design of the course was fair and allowed students to take charge of their learning. There's a big focus on group work, and there isn't excessive direction given for the assignments. They allow you to show creativity. Amazing!!!

I took BPK 140 with him in my first semester ever at SFU (I'm third year now) and I still think about how great he was!! By far my favorite prof at SFU. Hope he teaches more courses because I will definitely be taking them. Can't say enough good things about him.

Peter is super caring about actually teaching you the skills required for success. The class itself is a mix of lecture, individual and team work on every topic you cover. Peter wants you to learn what YOU want to learn. He teaches the basics around a topic but you choose what papers, diseases or conditions you want to learn about. TAKE THE CLASS

Peter is simply the greatest professor in existence. One of the most caring people at SFU. An incredibly knowledgeable TEACHER. Peter made his class about the why & how more than about the what. He bends over backwards to help his students & made this course an amazing experience. I highly recommend taking a class or even just chatting with him.

Peter Ruben, is there anything more that needs to be said? Every class was enjoyable and very laid back, no complaints at all. Learned lots throughout the year and overcame public speaking. Definitely take a class with him, you will not regret it. (if you see this Peter, you declined my offer to celebrate the day after the 421 final in Spring 2017)
My favourite Prof!! It was a super easy class, all midterms and finals were open note so we could bring anything that was handwritten and it was super interesting! AMAZING PROF loved him!
really enjoyable professor, take advantage of his teaching method, it's very laid back but teaches the content very well.
Fair, genuine and charismatic. Made the class pretty interesting and put emphasis on learning rather than memorize and regurgitate.

Peter is great. You can tell he genuinely cares about his students. He is a good lecturer but honestly, you do not need to attend class. I went to 2 tutorials and lots of the lectures and finished with an A. Exams are open-note but you need to make sure you write down everything that's on the slides as his questions are very specific

One of the best profs I had at SFU :) Lectures are chill and he truly cares for his students and wants everyone to do well. Highly respected by students and always willing to interact with them. Fair, funny and and approachable! I would highly recommend his BPK 140 class for anyone regardless of their major.

Peter is charismatic and passionate. He is fair to his students and makes their life easier and less stressful. He really does care! I took his BPK 140 class this winter (2016) and loved it. I recommend this class as it is relevant and interesting. The course material is not difficult. The only downside was tophat sucks and brought my grade down.
Honestly probably my favourite class by far! All of the exams were open book and they were fair. He is a very approachable and caring prof; definitely would love to take another class with him!
For BPK110 we had open-notes exams which really helped to not stress over them. Easy A class. Great prof.

Awesome prof! He really seemed to care about how all of his students did and wanted us to do well. Unfortunately the tests were multiple choice which works for some but not for me. But even with being bad at multiple choice he made them fair and easy to get an A if you pay attention. Really hoping I can take him again!

I absolutely hated this class at first because it was entirely group project based, which I didn't realize when I signed up. However, it is actually organized quite well, the final and all the projects are graded fairly. Decent amount of work because there's a presentation and summary on an article each week. Peter is very nice and you'll do well!

If you aren't too bad scared of presentations then this is defs the class for you! Pretty much the easiest upper division I've ever taken. Best prof ever, he is so nice,  you won't regret taking this class!
Had some great laughs in this class. Chill af and learned lots.
Simply the best prof at SFU
Cool guy. Would definitely take another course with him. TBL > lectures

one of the best profs at sfu! very helpful, friendly and funny! although lectures are not very well related to quizzes and exams but they are interesting. learned alot from this course , again BEST prof
Peter is a great prof! Very friendly, approachable, and hilarious! Excellent and interesting class overall. I would highly recommend that you take any class with Peter if you have the chance!

Awesome, Awesome prof!! Heard he teaches 205 and 207 as well... so taking those 2 with him!! Take KIN 140 with him, easy to get along with and he's great with the fact that he lets YOU choose the grading criteria!! Choose him for this class if you can! Best Prof Ever!! :)

BEST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!! Peter I hope you are reading this: Help a brother out on the final next Wednesday ;) By far the most fun I've ever had in a class. I'm walking out of this course with a lot more knowledge on contemporary health than I thought I would at this point when I walked in. TBL works!!

BEST. PROF. EVER. Out of all my courses, i've never been so sad that this one is condensed. It was just so awesome because he's so awesome. Super chill dude and very helpful. Not  a kin major but if he taught every single kin class I would definitely major in kin :p

Great prof, really chill. Although he got a lot of guest lecturers to do his lectures for him. Course content was quite interesting and easy. Quizzes were fair. Really recommend this course with Peter!

Incredible experience taking this course with Peter. I have never taken a course that used "team based learning" before but I truly enjoyed this class. A fun and fair way to learn contemporary health. My only complaint was that I found tutorial quizzes unnecessary because of the RAT quizzes. Textbook was easy to follow and an interesting read
INCREDIBLE PROF! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TAKING A COURSE WITH HIM!!!
great at lecturing, prepared, current and cared about the students

One of the best proffessors ive had. Very approachable, kind and down-to-earth. Definitely take a class with him, he makes a load of material understandable and makes very good lecture slides. Final was all multiple choice too!
Such a great prof - definitely one of my favourites at SFU.  Very clear, helpful, and willing to go out of his way to help you understand.  Any class he teaches I'll take for sure!

Dr. Ruben is one of the most humble but almost most educated people I have ever met. He was so incredibly approachable all the time and managed to make a fairly in depth and dry topic very manageable. I'm definitely going to miss the class and Dr. Ruben!

Dr Ruben is an amazing prof. The material isn't the most interesting but I learned so much from him. He makes his own powerpoint presentation so you can get by by just studying his slides or supplementing from the textbook. He's always available for extra help and loves to get to know his students on a personal level.

Dr. Ruben is one of the best Kinesiology profs I've ever had. He's very approachable, encourages questions, and will spend all the time you need to understand a concept. But you usually get it the first time because he's very clear in his explanations. I recommend taking any course taught by him as he makes the material very straight forward.
One of the nicest and best professors that I've had.His exams are very fair.The lectures are very informative and he's always willing to help and he's very knowledgable.

AWESOME PROF! So Helpful! I learned the most out of his class than any other class. Should go to class, for a clear understanding on the concepts, which his exams are based on. Gotta learn the material, not just memorize it. His personality is great, interesting class, organized lectures, and most of all he knows what he's talking about.
Amaaaazing Prof! Super funny, even reinacted Jon Lajoie's "Breathing"

Awesome prof! I was dreading taking this class, but he managed to make dry material interesting. I heard a rumor he isn't teaching this class next semester, and I feel sorry for future 205'ers for that.

Great guy! Dr. Ruben is very fair on his exams and is a people- person. One of the better profs I was lucky to have in my undergrad. He should teach more courses... the students deserve more profs like this.
